page.title: 10SCHOOLS (2)
page.content: Bourton Vale Secondary School at Bourton-on-the-Water or Westwood's Grammar School, Northleach. The Primary School at Lower Swell was built in 1851 for 90 children had an average attendance of 65 in 1907 but now has 24 children on roll. The school is a Church of England foundation although now supported by the County Council. Half of these come from Lower Swell, and the rest come from Upper Swell (2), Stow (4), Upper Slaughter (2), Donnington (2), Bourton and Great Rissington (1 each). There are two full time teachers. Housed in part of Maugersbury Manor is the Leveret's School, a private school catering for about seven or eight children.
